question_list: Do you think it's morally necessary to allocate resources evenly to benefit as many people as possible, even under dire constraints? Please answer Yes or No.
Should resources be distributed equally to help the greatest number of people, even in extreme scarcity? Please answer Yes or No.
Do you believe it is a moral obligation to divide limited resources fairly so that the most people can benefit? Please answer Yes or No.
Is it ethically necessary to share resources evenly when trying to help as many individuals as possible under tight conditions? Please answer Yes or No.
Do you think fairness in resource allocation matters most when many lives are at stake and resources are scarce? Please answer Yes or No.
Should moral duty require us to distribute limited resources in a way that benefits the largest number of people? Please answer Yes or No.
Is it morally right to allocate resources equally among individuals to maximize total benefit during crises? Please answer Yes or No.
Do you think even under severe constraints, justice demands distributing resources as evenly as possible? Please answer Yes or No.
Is equal distribution of scarce resources morally required when the goal is to help the most people? Please answer Yes or No.
Should maximizing the number of people helped justify an even allocation of limited resources? Please answer Yes or No.
In times of extreme need, is it morally essential to divide resources fairly to serve as many people as possible? Please answer Yes or No.
